definitions.definition: To reach a partly (or totally) unconfirmed conclusion ; to engage in conjecture ; to speculate .
examples: We can only guess at what was going through her mind.
She guessed that the delivery driver must have got stuck in traffic.

definitions.definition: To solve by a correct conjecture ; to conjecture rightly.
examples: He who guesses the riddle shall have the ring.
You will never guess what happened next.

definitions.definition: to suppose , to imagine (introducing a proposition of uncertain plausibility).
examples: That album is quite hard to find, but I guess you could try ordering it online.

definitions.definition: To think, conclude, or decide (without a connotation of uncertainty). Usually in first person: "I guess".
examples: "I guess you were right." "What did he say?" "He guesses you were right."

definitions.definition: To hit upon or reproduce by memory .

main_definition: To reach a partly (or totally) unconfirmed conclusion ; to engage in conjecture ; to speculate .
secondary_definitions: To solve by a correct conjecture ; to conjecture rightly.
( chiefly US ) to suppose , to imagine (introducing a proposition of uncertain plausibility).
( colloquial ) To think, conclude, or decide (without a connotation of uncertainty). Usually in first person: "I guess".
( obsolete ) To hit upon or reproduce by memory .
